result.execSummary:
The defendant Robin N Gavinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: This sentence is to be consecutive to any other sentences in being at that time.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution in the amount of $648.95 to Pitzner Farms LLC of Jefferson
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee
--to pay costs of $268 plus the 250 DNA surcharge

--to undergo assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--not to possess or consume alcohol or illegal drugs
--no contact with any known drug offenders except for purposes of treatment with agent approval 
--not to drive a motor vehicle without a valid Drivers License and Agent approval
--the defendant will not discontinue mental health and AODA treatment unless he is either discharged by the treatment provider or given permission from his agent to discontinue treatment.
--The Court orders that Mr. Gavinski's bail money be used to pay for fines/ costs/ restitution:

Arresting agency: JCSD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

  Pursuant to Wis. Stats. 303.01(8), and to facilitate the rehabilitative objective of sentencing, the Department of Corrections shall deduct 25% from inmate wages to pay restitution as ordered by the court.

timeConds.notes:
--to serve 8 months in the Jefferson County Jail, in 30 day increments with work-release privileges, to commence on June 7, 2015 at 7:00 pm. The 30 day increments will begin on the 7th day of every month
---Mr. Gavinski is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.

05-28-2015 The Court modifies the jail condition of Probation; with all other conditions remaining the same as previously ordered:

--to serve 8 months in the Jefferson County Jail, in 30 day increments with work-release privileges, to commence on July 15, 2015 at 7:00 pm. The 30 day increments will begin on the 15th day of every month.

Case called at 3:16pm [mo]
Defendant Robin N Gavinski in court with Attorney Karl Huebner on behalf of Attorney Miguel Adolfo Michel.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On the Defendant's 5/21/15 Motion to Modify Condition of Probation:
--Atty. Huebner makes arguments to modify the commencement date of the jail sentence, to allow Mr. Gavinski time to recuperate after his surgery.
--Arguments against the modification given by ADA Shock
--The Court and Defense discuss recovery time needed; Atty. Huebner submits 'Nurse's Notes'. 
--The Court and Defense discuss the document submitted by Atty. Huebner
--The Court grants the Defendant's motion to modify Probation

The Court modifies the jail condition of Probation; with all other conditions remaining the same as previously ordered:
--to serve 8 months in the Jefferson County Jail, in 30 day increments with work-release privileges, to commence on June 15, 2015 at 7:00 pm. The 30 day increments will begin on the 15th day of every month.

Case called at 8:34am [mo]
Defendant Robin N Gavinski in court with Attorney Miguel Adolfo Michel.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court acknowledges reviewing the Pre- Sentence Investigation and the recently filed correction.
ADA Teuber makes a correction as to the conditional jail time served in the 1980 conviction
--No objection from Atty. Michel
Atty. Michel makes a correction as to the usage of Mr. Gavinski's girlfriends car, he corrects that it only occurred one time. 
--No objection from ADA Teuber

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Teuber 
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Michel
--Atty. Michel tenders letters to the Court regarding: an upcoming surgery of Mr. Gavinski, results of recent drug screen, and 2 letters from treatment providers
Statement made by Mr. Gavinski


On Count #1, the Court IMPOSES & STAYS 3 1/2 years prison with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year &  6  months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2  years This sentence is to be consecutive to any other sentences in being at that time.   

The Court places the Defendant on Probation for 3  years, with conditions:
--to serve 8 months in the Jefferson County Jail, in 30 day incriements with work-release privileges, to commence on June 7, 2015 at 7:00 pm. The 30 day increments will begin on the 7th day of every month
---Mr. Gavinski is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to undergo assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--not to possess or consume alcohol or illegal drugs
--no contact with any known drug offenders excpept for purposes of treatment with agent approval 
--not to drive a motor vehicle without a valid Drivers License and Agent approval
--the defendant will not discontinue mental health and AODA treatement unless he is either discharged by the treatment provider or given permission from his agent to discontinue treatment.

The Court orders that Mr. Gavinski's bail money be used to pay for fines/ costs/ restitution:
--to pay costs of $268 plus the 250 DNA surcharge
--to pay restitution in the amount of $648.95 to Pitzner Farms LLC of Jefferson
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee


The Court orders the mandatory 6 month drivers license suspension
Days credit for time already served:  19 days
recess: 9:30am

Case called at 10:49 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Robin N Gavinski in court with Attorney Miguel Adolfo Michel. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Michel submits plea paperwork, and indicates that there is no agreement in this case; withdraws NGI plea
DA Happ informs the Court that there is no written agreement, but the State will be recommending prison in this case
Upon questioning of the Court, DA Happ indicates they are requesting PSI, Atty Michel indicates that they are not requesting, but of one is ordered then they will be also conducting independent evaluation

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
Court orders PSI to be completed; report to be submitted by May 5, 2015 - including defense
Court reminds Mr. Gavinski that his bond/conditoins of release remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 11:02 am

case called at 9:22am. [MK]
Defendant Robin N Gavinski in court with Attorney Miguel A Michel.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Michel acknowledges receipt of Dr. Freiburger's NGI-examination report, and indicates that he needs time to go over it with Mr. Gavinski.  Thereafter he would like to have a pre-trial opportunity to meet with the District Attorney. 
After hearing arguments from counsel on the Defendant's Motion to Reduce Cash Bail, the Court grants the Motion and reduces the required amount to $3,000.  The Court directs the clerk to refund $2,000 of the amount posted to the surety.
The Court clarifies to Mr. Gavinski that the conditions of Bond remain in effect as previously ordered.
recess 9:29am. 
[Clerk's added note: post hearing Attorney Michel provided a new telephone number for Mr. Gavinski. This phone number was entered into the demographics section within the case  in CCAP. Also post-hearing, the clerk informed Attorney Michel that the clerk erred in providing the 2/25/15 Pretrial Conference date announced in court.  The Pretrial Conference is rescheduled to 2/18/15 at 1:00pm.]

NEXT:  (1) clerk to refund $2,000 portion of the Cash Bond amount posted to the Surety (2) Pretrial Conference on 2/18/15 at 1:00pm.  (3) Status Conference on 3/5/15 at 9:30am.

case called at 8:16am. [MK]
Defendant Robin N Gavinski in court with Attorney Miguel A. Michel.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
After hearing arguments from counsel on the Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond, the Court grants the Motion in part, so that Mr. Gavinski can drive for limited purposes.  The Amended Bond is: 
The Court requires $5,000.00 cash bond (already posted), with conditions: 
-Not to operate a motor vehicle, except that Mr. Gavinski may operate a motor vehicle to get to and from court proceedings and also for purposes of going through the NGI evaluation with Dr. Freiburger. 
-Not to leave the State of Wisconsin

The Defense enters a NGI Plea. The Court accepts this dual plea.
The Court appoints Dr. James Freiburger to conduct the criminal responsibility examination; Dr. Freiburger's report is to be filed by 1/12/15; this deadline may be extended by 15 days if Dr. Freiburger finds he needs further time due to the forthcoming holidays. 
The Court refers the case to Branch III/Judge Wambach for further scheduling.  
recess 8:30am.  

NEXT:  case is referred to Branch III for further scheduling--possibly a Status Conference in late January, after the NGI examination outcome is known

case called at 8:47am. [MK]
Defendant Robin N Gavinski in court with Attorney Miguel A. Michel.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Michel indicates that there is no resolution of the case at this point, though there is a proposed Criminal Case Settlement pending.  This CCS is subject to change depending on the outcome of Mr. Gavinski's pursuit of mental health diagnoses; Mr. Gavinski is hoping to have an appointment related to this later this week, however if he cannot get that appointment, then the next available appointment is in January.
Attorney Michel requests the scheduling of a Status Conference in late December.  
recess 8:49am.

case called at 9:19am. 
Defendant Robin N Gavinski in court, in custody, with Attorney Yelena O. Zarwell.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Gavinski waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

The Court hears arguments on the Defendant's 8/25/14 Motion to Modify Cash Bond.  
The Court denies the Motion.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered
recess 9:33am.

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/17/14 at 9:20am  (2) schedule Status Conference in the week following the Pretrial date

Case called at 1:37 pm  (clerk- SF)
Defendant Robin N Gavinski in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Zarwell from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court and defendant discuss his understanding of the criminal complaint. 
Based on the Defendant's responses the Court and Attorney Zarwell discuss if there are concerns regarding competency.
Court reviews criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause, Court presents basis and finds that the defendant is competent.
Court verifies with the Defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $5,000.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-Not to operate a motor vehicle
-Not to leave the State of Wisconsin

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 10 day time limit.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 

Recess: 1:56 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 8/29/14 at 9:00 am
